headerDisplay: Homebridge plugin for controlling an electromagnetic lock via Raspberry Pi GPIO pins connected to a relay.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the accessory, e.g., Lock.

doorName.title: Name
doorName.description: The name of the door contact, e.g., Lock.

bellName.title: Name
bellName.description: The name of the bell switch, e.g., Gong.

lockPin.title: Lock GPIO pin
lockPin.description: GPIO pin used for unlocking the lock (use Raspberry Pi numbering).

buzzerPin.title: Active buzzer GPIO pin
buzzerPin.description: GPIO pin connected to the active buzzer (use Raspberry Pi numbering).

bellPin.title: Switch GPIO pin
bellPin.description: GPIO pin connected to the switch (use Raspberry Pi numbering).

doorPin.title: Reed switch GPIO pin
doorPin.description: GPIO pin connected to the reed switch (use Raspberry Pi numbering).

tamperPin.title: Tamper GPIO pin
tamperPin.description: GPIO pin connected to the power (use Raspberry Pi numbering).

activeLow.title: Relay activated by low state?
activeLow.description: Set to true if the relay is activated by a low state (0), false if activated by a high state (1). This setting affects the lockPin.

unlockingDuration.title: Unlocking duration (seconds)
unlockingDuration.description: The duration for which the lockPin should be active in seconds (default: 2).

pollingInterval.title: Polling interval (seconds)
pollingInterval.description: The frequency at which to poll the accessory status in seconds (default: 2).
